page.title: 04FARMING
page.content: Around the town of{Matlock}there are about twenty-five farms.Most of these are fairly small and keep animals as well as growing crops. Most farmers have some{cows}-usually black and white{Friesians}and these give milk which is collected from the farms each day by bulk tanker lorry. The farmers grow grass in some fields to feed the cows.They make hay and silage to last through the winter months.When the fields have been mown, sheep are often fattened up for market on the short grass.Most farmers have hens and a few have pigs. Wheat and barley are grown on some fields and some fields are planted with potatoes and turnips. The farmers sell their animals at{ {Bakewell Market}and some corn goes to the{mill }at {Two Dales}to be made into animal foodstuffs. {
